meanings.definition: To sail faster or better than another vessel.
meanings.sent1: The small boat managed to outsail the larger ship in the race.
meanings.sent2: The experienced captain knew how to outsail the competition with ease.
meanings.sent3: The turtle challenged the rabbit to a sailing race, hoping to outsail it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outsail her fears led her to new horizons.
meanings.sent5: The wind's strength helped the sailboat outsail all others on the water.

meanings.sent1: Despite his size, the young sailor could outsail even the most experienced captains.
meanings.sent2: The new yacht design was able to outsail all previous records for speed.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to outsail the seagull in a friendly sailing competition.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for sailing allowed her to outsail any doubts about her abilities.
meanings.sent5: The magical boat seemed to outsail the laws of physics as it glided effortlessly.
